questions.text: A 22-year-old man develops the insidious onset of low back pain improved with exercise and worsened by rest. There is no history of diarrhea, conjunctivitis, urethritis, rash, or nail changes. On examination, the patient has loss of mobility with respect to lumbar flexion and extension. He has a kyphotic posture. Which test or group of tests would be most supportive of suspected diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: ESR, HLA-B27 and plain X ray of the sacroiliac joints

options.label: C
options.text: Rheumatoid factor, anti-CCP, and C-reactive protein level.

questions.correct_answer: B. ESR, HLA-B27 and plain X ray of the sacroiliac joints

questions.text: A patient involved in a road traffic accident is brought to the surgery emergency with shortness of breath. HRCT was done. A 3-D reconstruction of the CT is shown. True about this condition are all except:

options.label: C
options.text: For a diagnosis fracture of >2 ribs at > 2 locations

questions.text: Which of the following option matches the image above ?
What is the investigation:
A child present with abdominal distension and vomiting? X ray abdomen was done which is shown below. What is false regarding the condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Occurs due to failure of vacuolisation of duodenum during development

options.label: C
options.text: Most cases present with non-bilious vomiting

questions.correct_answer: C. Most cases present with non-bilious vomiting

questions.text: 24 years old ramesh presents with pain over the bridge of the nose. It was aggravated by movements of eyeballs.Examination revealed oedema of both eyelids and swelling of the middle turbinate. Involvement of which of the following para-nasal sinus is suspected.
The procedure can diagnose a/e:

A 33-year-old woman was admitted to the hospital because of anorexia, malaise, jaundice, and right upper quadrant abdominal pain for the past 2 days. The woman, who was 2 months’ pregnant, was diagnosed with hyperthyroidism 1 month ago and started an appropriate therapy. Pertinent lab results on admission included alanine aminotransferase of 410 U/L (normal 20?40 U/L). Which of the following drugs most likely caused the patient’s disorder?

A 39 years old primigravida underwent caesarean section in view of breech presentation. According to WHO’s endorsed ROBSON’s classification (TEN GROUP CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM), this patient would be classified in which group?
Abnormalities of copper metabolism are implicated in the pathogenesis of all the following except: Wilson’s disease
What is the radiotherapy of choice in post operative case of chordoma?

A boy having unilateral nasal obstruction with epistaxis for several months. ON CT PNS it is found to have enhancing lesion with minimal extension to sphenoid sinus & no lateral extension. Comment on the stage as per Fischclassification ?
A 28 year old pregnant patient with history of 3 abortions and one live birth at 7 months of gestation comes with 36 weeks twin pregnancy. Her obstetric formula is

An 8-year-old boy has complained of difficulty swallowing for the past month. On physical examination he has a palpable, firm mass in the right neck. A head CT scan reveals a 7 cm solid soft tissue mass lateral to the esophagus on the right. A biopsy of this mass demonstrates pleomorphic round to spindle cells that are cytokeratin negative, CD45 negative, and vimentin&desmin positive. Which of the following neoplasms is he most likely to have?
A 29-year-old man presents with duodenal peptic ulcer and complains of cramping epigastric pain. Which of the following structures harbors the cell bodies of abdominal pain fibers?

options.label: A
options.text: Lateral horn of the spinal cord

options.label: B
options.text: Anterior horn of the spinal cord

questions.text: A patient who had already undergone cholecystectomy 6 years back presents with pain abdomen, jaundice. USG is suggestive of dilated CBD 11 mm and IHBRD. MRCP picture is shown below. Most common type of stone in this condition is?
8 yr old student c/o no interest in studies 4 last 6 months , has frequent quarrels with parents and has frequent headaches. Most appropriate clinical approach is:

An 8 year old boy presents with Right Hip Pain and Limping Gait for last one week. The mothers gives history of recent URTI in last month only. The examination revealed limitation of hip movements only in extremes. Blood counts are almost normal except Raised ESR. What is the diagnosis ?

A 2-year-old boy was admitted to the emergency department after a generalized tonic-colonic seizure. His mother reported that the boy apparently ingested several tablets of propranolol, a ?-blocker, which he had found in his father’s dresser drawer. Vital signs on admission were blood pressure 85/50 mm Hg, heart rate 40 beats per minute (bpm), respiratory rate 20/min. The boy received an intramuscular injection of glucagon, a hormone that activates glucagon receptors in the heart, caus- ing a significant increase in heart contractility. Which of the following terms best defines the antagonism between gluca- gon and ?-blockers?

A 50-year-old woman, who has been incarcerated for the past 5 years in a jail at Delhi, is brought to the prison hospital with a cough productive of bloody sputum. She reports experiencing a persistent cough for approximately 2 months, but in the last few days she has noticed an increase in sputum production with the presence of blood. She claims she has lost approximately 7 kgs in the past few months and has had night sweats for about 1 month. Not allergic to any medications. Rest of her medical history is unremarkable. On examination, she appears thin and frail. Her vital signs are normal. Her lung exam is notable for decreased breath sounds, diffusely. A chest radiograph demonstrates a cavity infiltrate of the right upper lobe. Choose the method(s) from the list would best confirm the identity of the most likely pathogen of this infection? 1. Ziehl – Neelsen stain, 2. Auramine – Rhodamine stain, 3. Acridine orange stain, 4. Auramine O Phenol stain
Which of the following investigations is not done in a case of infertility for assessing tubal patency?
which of following is caused by microdeletion A. angelman syndrome B. Digeorge syndrome C. Holt oram syndrome D. Prader Willi syndrome
questions.correct_answer: A. a, b, d are correct

questions.text: A patient with quadriplegia has a pressure sore overlying the right ischial tuberosity approximately 4 × 5 cm in size extending in to the subcutaneous tissue but not invading the deep fascia(shown in figure), expressible malodorous fluid, and surrounding cellulitis. What is the stage of the pressure ulcer?
A 45 year old male has multiple vesicular lesions, present unilaterally over the upper trunk. Lesions are having severe burning sensation since last night. Most likely diagnoses?

A 3500 g full-term male infant is delivered by Cesarean section because of breech presentation. He is admitted tc the intensive care unit because of mild respiratory distress. His symptoms resolve by 8 hours of age. Oral feedings progress poorly because of sleepiness and a weak suck Physical examination reveals an appropriately grown infant with hypotonia and subtle dysmoiphic features including almond-shaped eyes and bitemporal wasting. The rest of his examination is normal except his testes are undescended bilaterally. What is the most likely diagnosis of the infant in this vignette?

A 45-year-old man dies suddenly and unexpectedly. Autopsy confirms immediate cause of death is found to be a hemorrhage in the right basal ganglia region. Further on microscopic examination his renal artery branches have concentric endothelial cell proliferation which markedly narrows the lumen, resulting in focal ischemia and hemorrhage of the renal parenchyma. An elevation in which of the following substances in his blood is most likely to be associated with these findings?

A 55-year-old lady presents with flaccid bullae and slow-healing erosions on head and trunk. She also has painful oral erosions. She gives history of similar episode in past which required treatment in hospital. The most likely structure damaged in the patient is:

A 50 -year-old man presented with fever, cough, sputum, right-sided pleuritic chest pain and dyspnea. Chest x-ray reveals a consolidation right lower zone and CBC shows an elevated neutrophil count. Which feature would most strongly support inpatient admission for management?

options.label: D
options.text: Purulent sputum with gram-positive diplococci on Gram stain

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about vascular anastomosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Suture material must pass from out to in on the downflow aspect of anastomosis

questions.correct_answer: B. Suture material must pass from out to in on the downflow aspect of anastomosis

questions.text: All of the following statement are true about Bartter syndrome &Gitelmann’s syndrome are true except:

options.label: B
options.text: Bartter’s syndrome presents earlier in life than Gitelmann’s syndrome

options.label: C
options.text: Hypercalciuria is common in Bartter’s syndrome

options.label: D
options.text: Genetic defect in barter syndrome involves transporter protein in distal tubule

questions.correct_answer: D. Genetic defect in barter syndrome involves transporter protein in distal tubule

questions.text: The assimilation of fats include (1) secretion of chylomicrons (2) micelle formation (3) absorption of fats by the enterocytes (4) emulsification of fats. Which of the following correctly describes the sequence of events?

A 69-year-old man was recently diagnosed with severe car- diac failure, and the physician started treatment with pro- pranolol, captopril, and digoxin. Diuretic therapy was also included. Which of the following pairs of diuretics would have been most appropriate for this patient?
All are causes except:
Which of the following is the pre trematic nerve of first pharyngeal arch?

A 26 years old G2P1L1 with 39 weeks of gestation and cephalic presentation has labour pains since 6 hours. On examination, the uterus is corresponding to period of gestation, FHS are normal, head is engaged, cervical dilatation is 2 cm and membranes are intact. On repeat examination after 4 hours, the findings were same but uterine contractions had increased from one contraction per 10 minutes to 2 contractions in 10 minutes, each contraction lasting for 10 seconds. What should be the next line of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Give inj. Oxytocin @ 5mIU/minute in the dilution of 10mIU/ml RL

options.label: B
options.text: Do an artificial rupture of membranes

options.label: C
options.text: Give sedation and watch for progress of labour

options.label: D
options.text: Chart partogram and watch for progress of labour

questions.correct_answer: C. Give sedation and watch for progress of labour

questions.text: ABER is calculated as:

options.label: A
options.text: (Confirmed cases during 1 year * 1000)/ Population under surveillance

options.label: C
options.text: (Number of slides positive for P. fp * 100)/ Population

options.label: D
options.text: (Confirmed cases of P. vivax during 1 year * 1000)/ Population under surveillance

questions.text: Lesser petrosal nerve derives preganglionic fibers from:

A 8-year-old boy is brought to the pediatric emergency room due to sudden onset of facial swelling 2 hours ago. He has had no itching or pain other than a sore throat over the past 2 days, for which he has taken acetaminophen. The patient has had similar episodes of facial swelling that resolved spontaneously after a few days. On examination, his temperature is 370 C, blood pressure is 100/78 mm Hg, pulse is 95/min, and respirations are 24/min. He completed all the childhood vaccinations. Examination shows nonpitting edema of the cheeks, lips, and tongue; there is no tenderness or erythema. The appearance of his face is shown in the image. All other systems examination findings are are normal. The clinician suspected this condition is due to some immunological disorder and he ordered the tests. Based the history and physical examination findings, Which of the following studies is most likely to be abnormal in this case?

A 9-year-old boy is brought to the OPD due to throat pain and rash. Two days ago, the patient was sent is home early from summer camp because of fever, sore throat, pain with eating, and rash on his extremities. He has no prior medical conditions and is up to date on immunizations. Temperature is 99 F; vital signs are otherwise normal. On physical examination, the conjunctivae are normal, and the tympanic membranes are clear. Several super?cial ulcers are present on the buccal mucosa and soft palate; the tonsils appear normal and do not have exudate. Skin examination ?ndings are shown in the image. The infectious agent most likely responsible for this patient's current condition is also associated with which of the following ? 1. Myocarditis, 2. Juvenile DM, 3. Aseptic meningitis 4. BornHolm disease
Which of the following is true regarding the condition depicted in the figure?

options.label: B
options.text: It is a type 4 hypersensitivity reaction

options.label: D
options.text: It occurs in palpebral, limbal and mixed forms

questions.correct_answer: D. It occurs in palpebral, limbal and mixed forms

questions.text: Mr. Tandon had an ECG at a local clinic, but he misplaced the ECG record soon after. The ECG technician remembers that the QRS deflection was large and positive in lead II and 0 in aVL. What is his mean electrical axis in the frontal plane?

A 35 years old G3P1A1L1 with 30 weeks of gestation with twin gestation has discordance in the weight of the twins. There is oligohydramnios in one sac and polyhydramnios in another sac. The bladder of the small baby is not visible. There is no abnormality of umbilical artery doppler flow study yet. Which is this STAGE of Quintero classification?
Match the apps with their usage:

A 43-year-old man had to undergo surgery to remove a bili- ary calculus. The anesthesiologist chose to supplement the anesthesia with succinylcholine, a paralyzing agent that has a rapid onset and a short duration of action. In this patient, however, the drug-induced paralysis lasted several hours, ne- cessitating the anesthesiologist to continue the anesthesia and continue artificial respiration. Which of the following adverse drug reactions best explains the patient’s disorder?
Pulsusparadoxus is found in all of following except:

A healthy 28-year-old woman stands up from the supine position. Moving from supine to standing position causes a transient decrease in arterial pressure that is detected by the arterial baroreceptors located in the carotid sinus and aortic arch. Which of the following cardiovascular changes are NOT likely to be seen in this individual?

A 78-year-old man from a nursing home was admitted to the emergency department because of a change in his mental state over the past few hours. He had a medical history of angina and hypertension presently treated with isosorbide mononitrate, losartan, and hydrochlorothiazide. Physical ex- amination showed a person with decreased skin turgor and disorientation to time and place without focal neurologic deficits. Blood pressure was 110/65 mm Hg on standing and 140/88 mm Hg on lying. Pertinent blood tests on admission were Na+ 116 mEq/L (normal 136?145 mEq/L); K+ 3.1 mEq/L (normal 3.5?5.0 mEq/L); uric acid 10.2 mg/dL (normal 3.0? 8.2 mg/dL); creatinine 3.1 mg/dL (normal 0.6?1.2 mg/dL). The physician thought that the syndrome was due to diuretic therapy. Which of the following drug-induced adverse effects most likely caused the patient’s signs and symptoms?

A 75-year-old diabetic man with Parkinson disease com- plained of worsening of his tremor and rigidity in his arms and legs. His Parkinson disease had been responding well to a treatment with levodopa/carbidopa and amantadine, and his diabetes had been controlled by glyburide and metformin. Recently, metoclopramide was prescribed to manage diabetic gastroparesis. Which of the following drugs could have trig- gered the worsening of symptoms reported by the patient?
Scarring alopecia is seen in all except

A 29-year-old man was admitted to the psychiatric hospital in a paranoid and hostile state. He was diagnosed with chronic paranoid schizophrenia at the age of 23 and had been re-hospitalized four times in the last 2 years, secondary to medication noncompliance. His medical work-up and urine drug screen were negative. During the last hospitalization, he had been stabilized on fluphenazine without any sign of adverse effects. Which of the following treatment would be appropriate for this patient?

A previously healthy 10-month-old girl presents to the emergency department with a 1-day history of fever, vomiting, and lethargy. The child has had a few upper respiratory infections and ear infections, but her history is otherwise unremarkable. The family has not vaccinated any of their children due to religious objections. The child’s temperature is 102°F. Physical exam reveals a positive Brudzinski’s sign. An organism from the CSF does not grow on blood or MacConkey agars but does grow on media supplemented with hemin and nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide (NAD). Choose the correct property/ properties of this pathogen from the list given below. 1. Poly saccharide capsule, 2. Gram negative diplococci, 3.Satellitism, 4. Polysaccharide vaccine for this patient

A 28 year old sustained a laceration on his leg, which was sutured under local anaesthesia in minor OT. He followed up for dressing every third day and got dressed by the nurse. On Day 8 he complains of fever, the surgeon looks at the wound there is a suppurative exudate from the wound, a culture shows staphylococcus aureus. Which of the following would have best prevented such an infection in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Proper sterilisation of the dressing instruments

options.label: C
options.text: Proper washing hands by the nurse before dressing

options.label: D
options.text: Allowing the wound to heal openly without dressing

questions.correct_answer: C. Proper washing hands by the nurse before dressing

questions.text: A 29 years old patient who had primary infertility, took 4 months of ATT and she conceived during the course of anti-tubercular therapy (6months). She does not remember her last menstrual period since the periods were irregular. On USG examination, there is a gestational sac in the ampullary part of the fallopian tube with sac size of 20mm with 3mm CRL without cardiac activity. Her b-HCG level is 12750 IU/L and her vitals are stable. What should be the best treatment of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Expectant management since it is dead foetus

questions.text: A Ramsteadpyloromyotomy was done for a CHPS. What layer bulges out after the incision?

A 44-year-old woman suffering from open-angle glaucoma had been receiving topical timolol for 3 months. The disease was well controlled, and the treatment stopped the progres- sion of optic nerve damage. Which of the following molecu- lar actions most likely mediated the therapeutic efficacy of the drug in the patient’s disease?
questions.correct_answer: C. Decreased activity of adenylate cyclase

questions.text: Ideal size of lesion of radiofrequency ablation of HCC is?

A 49-year-old man with a history of alcohol abuse has increasing abdominal girth. On examination his liver edge is firm. A liver biopsy shows cirrhosis, and individual hepatocytes contain red, globular inclusions positive for cytokeratin with immunohistochemical staining. Which of the following structural elements are these intracellular globules most likely to contain?
Which of the following mutations is not seen in hereditary pancreatic cancer?

A 28-yr-old boy presents with digital gangrene for last 4 weeks. On examination the blood pressure is 170/110 mm of Hg and all peripheral pulses were palpable. He gives history of Raynaud’s phenomenon and episodes of Hematuria. He has no fever, cough or hemoptysis. The Renal function test is normal with no dysmorphic RBC or cast in the urine. Antinuclear antibodies, antibody to double stranded DNA and anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibody were negative. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 43-year-old woman was in the emergency department for the treatment of shock due to spinal trauma. Despite fluid therapy, she was still hypotensive (80/50 mm Hg) and tachy- cardic (125 bpm). An intravenous infusion of norepineph- rine was started, and a few minutes later the blood pressure was 120/85 mm Hg, and the heart rate decreased to 85 bpm. Which of the following actions best explains the drug- induced decrease of heart rate in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased firing rate of vagal neurons

options.label: C
options.text: Increased firing rate of aortic baroreceptors

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased firing rate of carotid chemoreceptors

questions.correct_answer: C. Increased firing rate of aortic baroreceptors

questions.text: Destructive coagulation of tissues with charring in electrosurgery is termed as?

An 8-year-old boy is brought to the pediatrician by his father with a 2-day history of swelling in his hands and ankles and blood in his urine. The father states that about 2 weeks ago the boy had been sick with fever and complaining of a sore throat. They didn’t visit the doctor at that time because the boy felt better after 2 days without antimicrobial treatment. The boy’s temperature is 98.8°F and his blood pressure is 210/140 mm Hg. Physical demonstrates significant edema of the hands, wrists, feet, and ankles. A urine specimen is collected and results are given below: • Urinalysis–Dipstick – Blood: positive – Protein: positive – Leukocyte esterase: negative – Nitrite: negative Choose the structure(s) most likely directly involved in the development of the boy’s current condition? 1. Antigen-antibody complex, 2. β- Hemolysin, 3. M protein, 4.Superantigen
Which of the following gastric lymph nodes stations are correctly matched?

A 43-year-old man complains of abdominal pain just above his umbilicus. On examination, a tumor is found anterior to the inferior vena cava. Which of the following structures would most likely be compressed by this tumor?
questions.correct_answer: C. Third part of the duodenum

questions.text: Left sided portal hypertension is best treated by?
With regard to eukaryotic mRNAs, one of the following is not the property of mRNAs.

options.label: A
options.text: Eukaryotic mRNAs have special modifications at their 5? (cap) and 3?(poly(A) tail) termini.

options.label: B
options.text: Are attached to ribosomes when they are translated.

options.label: C
options.text: They are found in the cytoplasm within peroxisomes.

options.label: D
options.text: Most have significant noncoding segment that does not direct assembly of amino acids.

questions.correct_answer: C. They are found in the cytoplasm within peroxisomes.

questions.text: A 3 days old infant develops abdominal distension and has not passed meconium. Barium enema shows narrow segment of colon with dilated proximal intestine. Which of following has small left micro colon? a. Maternal DM b. Maternal hypothyroidism c. Prematurity d. Maternal valproate

A 16 years old patient has come with primary amenorrhoea. On examination she has normal height, Tanner stage 4 breast development. Her UPT is negative. What is not the possible cause in this case?

A 20-year-old woman presents with bilateral conductive deafness, palpable purpura on the legs and hemoptysis. Radiograph of the chest shows a cavity in left lower zone. Investigations reveal total leukocyte count 12000/mm, red cell casts in the urine and 12,000/mm3 serum creatinine 3 mg/dL. What is the most probable diagnosis?
All of the following are true about RapoportLuebering cycle except-
questions.correct_answer: D. Two ATPs are net produced

questions.text: A 22-year-old primigravida delivers a term girl infant following an uncomplicated pregnancy. However, she has marked blood loss during the delivery and receives 2 units of PRBCs. An hour following transfusion, her Hct is 28%, but she suddenly develops marked pruritus. Physical examination reveals blotchy urticaria of her skin. Vital signs record T 37.1°C, P 83/minute, RR 17/minute, and BP 110/75 mm Hg. The donors of the two units are contacted and interviewed. Which of the following behaviours by one of the donors is most likely to have caused her transfusion reaction?

options.label: B
options.text: Having sexual intercourse with a prostitute

questions.text: The curve’s shown in the image are:

A 5-year-old boy is admitted with fever and breathlessness. He was hospitalized many times for pyogenic infections. Pediatrician evaluated him for recurrent infections and failure to thrive. In the past one year, he has been hospitalized for pneumococcal pneumonia twice and has had 5 episodes of otitis media, requiring placement of tympanostomy tubes. The patient also has a history of prolonged diarrhea caused by Cryptosporidium parvum. Physical examination shows large tonsils, palpable lymph nodes, and hepatosplenomegaly. His HIV status is negative. Pediatrician ordered investigations for further evaluation. It shows that the patient has defective signaling between activated CD4+ T cells and B lymphocytes. Which of the following immunoglobulins likely has the highest serum concentration in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: iv bolus of 0.25 to 1 g/kg every 4 to 6 hours

options.label: C
options.text: iv bolus of 0.25 to 1 g/kg every 2 hours

options.label: D
options.text: iv bolus of 0.5 to 1 g/kg every 8 hours

questions.correct_answer: B. iv bolus of 0.25 to 1 g/kg every 4 to 6 hours

questions.text: A 23 year old lactating female is found to have serum calcium of 6.0 mg/dl. The manifestations will include all except:

A 10 year old boy is having a stunted growth, easy fatigue despite being fed properly. His height and weight fall in 3rd percentile for age. He complains of bloating and frothy stools. The stools float in the water. Examination shows bitot’s spots in the eye. Blood examination shows Hb 10g/dL, Serum iron studies and B12 levels are normal. The peripheral blood smear is as. Shown in the image. What is the likely pathogenesis in this child?

A 47-year-old man undergoes resection of a right cheek and retromolar trigone SCC wide local resection and modified neck dissection. There is a significant soft tissue deficit, and you decide to use a pectoralis myocutaneous flap for reconstruction. What is the arterial supply to this flap?

You are called to the delivery room to evaluate a full-term male infant who has just been born by vaginal birth. You observe that the infant is in severe respiratory distress without breath sounds on the left side. The infant's abdomen is scaphoid in appearance. What is the most appropriate initial management of this infant?

options.label: A
options.text: Insert a chest tube to evacuate air from the pleural space

options.label: B
options.text: Intubate the infant and minimize inflation pressure to achieve gentle ventilation

options.label: C
options.text: Place an umbilical venous line and start intravenous prostaglandin

options.label: D
options.text: Provide bag-mask ventilation with high positive inspiratory pressure to reinflate the collapsed lung

questions.correct_answer: B. Intubate the infant and minimize inflation pressure to achieve gentle ventilation

questions.text: The enzyme lipoprotein lipase is located at the endothelial layer of capillaries of the following tissues except

A neonatologist evaluates a male newborn with dysmorphic facial features. After examining the infant, the neonatologist suspects that the infant has Apert syndrome. Of the following, which is likely to be found in this infant?

A 65 year old man suffering from chronic kidney disease secondary to diabetes mellitus is on haemodialysis. Now he presents with pain in the hand, numbness in the palm. Imaging shows thickened tendons in the wrist. Likely etiology for such manifestation is?

options.label: A
options.text: Deposition of Advanced glycated proteins on the tendon sheath

options.label: B
options.text: Deposition of Urea crystals on tendon sheath

questions.text: Which of the following investigations in not necessary in a case of a patient who is having history of second trimester abortions in all three pregnancies in past?

In this pregnancy, her ICT was done @ 12 weeks and it was negative. What should be the next line of management?

22 years old Babu had fight with his neighbor’s son. Next day, which going to the bus stop, he left that 2 uniformed policemen were following him. On reaching home he was frightened and he felt that the neighbors were using radio waves to control his mind. What is his symptom :

options.label: C
options.text: Chemotherapy is must in this case with BEP therapy

options.label: D
options.text: It is most common germ cell cancer

questions.correct_answer: C. Chemotherapy is must in this case with BEP therapy

A 40-year-old patient presents with an excruciating headache. It is ill-localised and is explosive pain which begins without warning, reaches it's peak within 5 minutes and lasts for 45 minutes and commonly awakens the patient from sleep. It is associated with homolateral lacrimation and reddening of eye and ptosis and nasal stuffiness. Which of the following statements about the diagnosis is FALSE

options.label: B
options.text: Onset typically in 30-50 years of life

options.label: D
options.text: High flow oxygen can abort an attack.

questions.text: A 22-year-old man presents with multiple ivory- colored patches on back with pigmented borders and the lesion appears bound down and is difficult to pinch. They have been present for months. The likely diagnosis?
Which criteria in the given sample is problematic making the water unfit for consumption?
Nerve which loops around submandibular duct?

A 6 year child presents with periorbital swelling, facial puffiness, pedal edema. Blood examination shows Albumin of 2g/L, urine examination shows protein 3+, no RBC. He was started on steroids and salt restricted diet, the child’s edema is not subsiding even after 8 weeks of corticosteroid therapy. A renal biopsy was done histology shows fibrosis in few glomeruli, electron microscopy shows effacement of foot processes and no deposits. What is the likely diagnosis?
Acute infectious endophthalmitis after cataract surgery a/e :

options.label: A
options.text: Is usually associated with decreased visual acuity

options.label: E
options.text: Most commonly due to staphylococcus epidermidis

questions.text: A 78-year-old man was admitted to the hospital because of dyspnea, a nonproductive cough, and fever. The man had been receiving an antiarrhythmic drug for 2 months to treat refractory supraventricular tachycardia. A chest x-ray showed diffuse bilateral infiltrates. Bacterial, fungal, and viral cultures were negative. Which of the following drugs most likely caused the patient’s pulmonary disorder?

A 20 year old male presented to the clinic with history of fever with chills for past 2 days. He complained of associated headache and myalgia. The highest recorded temperature at home was 41? C and there was no particular pattern. Patient is case of Hereditary Spherocytosis and underwent Splenectomy for the same at 12 years of age since he was transfusion dependant. His vaccination history is complete. On examination he had a Temperature of 40? C, P-90/min, BP-100/60mm of Hg. He had pallor and icterus with no lymphadenopathy. Laboratory tests revealed a Hb-7.3gm/dl, WBC-4600, Plt-94000.His Liver function test showed an elevated bilirubin with elevated ALP, SGOT, SGPT. Urine analysis showed haemoglobinuria and proteinuria.Examination of Giemsa-stained thin smear revealed ameboidtrophozoites lacking hemozoin deposits. What is the diagnosis?

A 20 year girl is worried that she might develop a cancer after seeing a documentary on familial breast cancer on TV. Her mother developed left breast cancer at the age of 30 years which was treated with mastectomy and axillary clearance, six years later she developed carcinoma of right breast for which similar treatment was done. Later she died of metastatic breast carcinoma. Which of the following information is least helpful in making a suspicion of familial breast carcinoma in her?

options.label: A
options.text: He maternal uncle died of carcinoma pancreas

options.label: B
options.text: Her mother’s tumor cells showing BRCA 1 mutation

options.label: C
options.text: Bilateral breast carcinoma in her mother

options.label: D
options.text: Age of onset of carcinoma in mother

questions.correct_answer: B. Her mother’s tumor cells showing BRCA 1 mutation

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman c/o dyspnea for 4 months. On physical examination lungs are clear, P2 is loud, large V waves in JVP. Chest x-ray shows enlargement of the central pulmonary arteries. What is the confirmatory investigation in establishing a diagnosis in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Spirometry with measurement of diffusing capacity of carbon monoxide

A 34 year –old lady presented to the ER with sudden onset palpitations. She gives a history of having similar episodes in the past 3 months. The episodes occur sporadically with no relation to exertion. Each episode lasted for 10-15 mins and she noticed the need to use the restroom after the episodes. She has no other symptoms, or family history of similar disease. There is history of domestic stressors. She denies use any any OTC medications/recreational drugs. On examination the pulse is 126 bpm, regular in rhythm. BP is 124/80mm of Hg and the Spo2 is 98% on Room air. ECG shows a regular Narrow qrs complex tachycardia. What is the next step in treatment?

A 53-year-old woman feels a lump in her right breast. Her primary physician palpates an irregular 3 cm hard mass that is not movable because it appears fixed to the overlying skin, which is retracted. He is suspecting a carcinoma of breast. Which of the following pathological changes have led to such clinical findings in the patient?

A 53-year old smoker presents to you with cough and dyspnoea. He leans forward and struggles hard to exhale the air. He has been smoking cigarette for last 30 years now. He used to get intermittent cough which used to regress on transient cessation of smoking and home remedies, but this time the cough is not getting reduced even after 3 months of stopping smoking. Chest is hyper resonant percussion, heart sounds are faintly heard. His forced expiratory volume at 1 second (FEV1) is reduced however his forced vital capacity (FVC)is normal. His oxygen saturation is around 95%. Which of the following pathogenesis is leading to such manifestations?

options.label: A
options.text: Fibrosis of terminal smaller airways leading to obstruction

options.label: B
options.text: Fibrosis of larger bronchi and bronchioles leading to obstruction

options.label: C
options.text: Loss of elastic recoil of small airways leading to obstruction

options.label: D
options.text: Interstitial fibrosis leading to reduced expansion of lung.

questions.correct_answer: C. Loss of elastic recoil of small airways leading to obstruction

questions.text: Researchers analyze the HIV viral structure and replication cycle for new drug targets. They ?nd the virus encodes a large glycoprotein, which gets cleaved into 2 subunits, the surface and transmembrane subunits. These subunits remain noncovalently bound to each other in the virion. Upon activation of the surface protein, conformational changes occur in the transmembrane subunit exposing the functional inner core. A novel drug is developed that selectively binds and prevents normal functioning of the transmembrane subunit, interfering with the normal viral replication cycle. This agent most likely directly inhibits which of the following viral processes?

options.label: A
options.text: Attachment of the virus to target cell surface l

options.label: B
options.text: Budding and release of a new virus particle

options.label: C
options.text: Cleavage of polyproteins by viral encoded enzyme

options.label: D
options.text: Entry of the viral core into host cytoplasm

questions.correct_answer: D. Entry of the viral core into host cytoplasm

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman has pain in her fingers on exposure to cold, arthralgias, and difficulty swallowing solid food. On examination thickening of the skin over the hands, arms, and trunk is present. What is the best diagnostic workup?

options.label: C
options.text: Creatine kinase (CK) and ant synthetase antibodies (such as anti-Jo-1)

questions.correct_answer: B. Antinuclear, anti-Scl-70, and anticentromere antibodies

questions.text: Evaluation of a patient reveals the following deficits: - • Inability to process sequential thought to solve a problem • Decreased ambition and motivation • Inappropriate social responses • Inability to process multiple bits of information that could then be recalled to complete a thought or solve a problem Damage to which of the following could be responsible for the above mentioned deficits?

options.label: C
options.text: Parieto-occipital cortex in the non-dominant hemisphere

questions.text: A 50-year-old Female presented with proximal lower limb weakness for 6 weeks with purplish rash that involves both eyelids. The patient experiences pain while getting up from squatting position. Extra-ocular muscles andother Neurological examination is normal. There is no significant past medical history. What is the best next diagnostic test?

A 33 years old multiparous patient has abnormal PAP smear report suggestive of LSIL. She is subjected to colposcopy guided biopsy which reveals a small sub-centimetre sized acetowhite area on the transitional zone. There is no extension of lesion inside the endo cervix. The biopsy report is suggestive of CIN 2. What is the best line of treatment in this case?

A 23 years old G2P1L1 with 13 weeks of gestation has a history of passage of grape like vesicles for 1 day. On examination there is snow-storm appearance of products of conception. She is subjected to suction and evacuation. Her baseline b-HCG is 85000IU/L. Which of the following is correct regarding the further management?

options.label: A
options.text: She should be subjected to weekly b-HCG till it is undetectable and then monthly b-HCG for 12 months, COC pills for contraception.

options.label: B
options.text: She should be subjected to weekly b-HCG till it is undetectable and then monthly b-HCG for 6 months, Cu-T for contraception

options.label: C
options.text: She should be subjected to weekly b-HCG till it is undetectable and then monthly b-HCG for 6 months, COC pills for contraception

options.label: D
options.text: Weekly b-HCG till it is undetectable. Once it is negative, she is allowed to conceive if she desires.

questions.correct_answer: C. She should be subjected to weekly b-HCG till it is undetectable and then monthly b-HCG for 6 months, COC pills for contraception

questions.text: A 26 years old G3P1A1L1 with 13 weeks of gestation has come with history of a full-term normal delivery 1 year back and an abortion, 2 year back which was induced at 18 weeks for the presence of Down’s syndrome with VSD in foetus. She is on folic acid supplement since pre-conceptional period. What should be the best plan of action in this pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Do combined screening of first trimester which includes NT scan and DUAL marker test.

options.label: C
options.text: Increase the dose of folic acid to 4mg per day

options.label: D
options.text: Do quadruple marker test at 16 weeks and if it is positive then do amniocentesis.

questions.correct_answer: B. Do chorion villous sampling now.

questions.text: All of the following the clinical findings are consistent with severe mitral stenosis except
questions.correct_answer: C. Opening snap late after S2

questions.text: A 29 years old patient who had primary infertility, took 4 months of ATT and she conceived during the course of anti-tubercular therapy (6months). She does not remember her last menstrual period since the periods were irregular. On examination, the uterus is of size of hen’s egg, bilateral adnexa are normal. USG is suggestive of double bleb sign inside uterus with gestational sac size 20 mm. There are no fetal poles or cardiac motion. What should be the best plan of action for her?

options.label: A
options.text: Repeat USG one week later and continue ATT

options.label: B
options.text: Do serial B-HCG (2 samples one week apart) and continue ATT

options.label: C
options.text: Tell her to undergo MTP because 2 months of ATT is still pending.

options.label: D
options.text: Tell her that this is missed abortion since there is no fetal pole and continue her ATT after suction and evacuation.

questions.correct_answer: A. Repeat USG one week later and continue ATT

questions.text: Assume that you have a patient who needs fluid replacement and you decide to administer 2.0L of 0.45% NaCl solution. After osmotic equilibrium, which of the following set of changes will you expect, compared with before infusion of 0.45% NaCl solution?

questions.correct_answer: B. ↑ ECF volume, ↓ ECF osmolality, ↑ ICF volume, ↓ ICF osmolality

questions.correct_answer: C. History will likely provide important clues to the diagnosis.

The fetus lives in a relatively hypoxemic environment. The intrauterine circulation consists of two parallel systems that are not completely separated because of mixing at the atrial and ductal level. The following vessels/chambers have oxygen saturations from HIGHEST to LOWEST:

options.label: A

options.label: B

questions.text: A 27year old nulliparous patient has come with a history of dysmenorrhoea since 5 years. The pain usually begins 3-4 days before menses and continues during menses. On examination, there is an adnexal mass of 6-7 cm with tenderness. The uterus is retroverted and normal sized but the mobility is restricted. There is uterosacral nodularity. What should be the next line of management considering that she does not desire to become pregnant in coming 3 years?

options.label: C
options.text: Do laparoscopic cystectomy and ablation of all visible lesions of endometriosis

options.label: D
options.text: Do USG guided biopsy of adnexal mass to confirm the diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Do laparoscopic cystectomy and ablation of all visible lesions of endometriosis

questions.text: A 31 years old G3P2L2 with previous 2 LSCS done in view of fetal distress has come in active labour at 39 weeks of gestation. On examination, the uterus is corresponding to period of gestation. There are 3 contractions per 10 minutes with moderate intensities and the contractions are lasting for 30 seconds. There is no scar tenderness or fetal distress. The cervix is 6 cm dilated, 70% effaced, membranes got ruptured spontaneously on PV examination, the liquor is clear. Fetal head is in right occipito-posterior position at the level of ischial spine. The pelvis is roomy and adequate for the size of baby. What should be the next line of action?

options.text: Oral examination helps in the diagnosis.

questions.correct_answer: C. Oral examination helps in the diagnosis.

questions.text: A 16 years old girl has home with history of cyclic pain in her abdomen and pelvis since last 2 years. She has difficulty in passing urine since 1 day. She has not yet got her menses. Her secondary sexual characters are consistent with her age. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 24 years old G2P1L1 with 36 weeks of gestation has developed hypertension of 144/96 mm of Hg (recorded twice). Her urine albumin is 3+. She has no other symptoms but USG is suggestive of reduced diastolic flow in umbilical artery with S/D ratio of 4.2. The amniotic fluid index is 6cm. she is not in labour. Foetal weight is 15th percentile of the gestational age. She is admitted in hospital for further evaluation and investigations. Her investigations have come within normal range. What should be the plan of action in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Give anti-hypertensive and do immediate induction of labour

options.label: C
options.text: Give anti-hypertensive but continue pregnancy till 37 weeks

questions.text: Lateral sinus thrombosis is associated with all except:
Phacolytic glaucoma occurs due to:
What dietary modification would you like to advice this patient who is having constipation for 7 days and has provided the 24-hour dietary history as given below?

options.label: C
options.text: Increase intake of fruits and vegetables

options.label: D
options.text: Reassure the patient that his dietary habits are appropriate

questions.correct_answer: C. Increase intake of fruits and vegetables

questions.text: A 33 years old primigravida with 38 weeks of gestation and IUGR is to be subjected for induction of labour. Her cervix is soft, mid-posed, non-dilated, non-effaced and the station of the foetus is 2cm above the ischial spine. How much is her BISHOP’s score?

A 30-year-old man comes to the clinic with an acute febrile illness that developed after an adventure trip in the forest. The patient recalls getting tick bites in the woods but initially had no symptoms. He began experiencing fever, chills, malaise, headache, and myalgia a week after his return. Physical examination shows a diffuse, maculopapular rash; clear oropharynx; normal lung and heart sounds; and mild, diffuse abdominal tenderness. Laboratory testing reveals leukopenia, thrombocytopenia, and elevated aminotransferase levels. Microscopic evaluation of the blood demonstrates mulberry-shaped, intracytoplasmic inclusions in monocytes as shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely pathogen responsible for this patient's condition?
Which one of following characteristically differentiates "facticious disorder" from "malingering"?
Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Nidhi (PMSSN) includes all of the following except:
